pageContext.claim: “They wanted drones. I say, ‘What are you going to do? Take pictures of everyone flowing across?’ They didn't want to say. They said, ‘No, no. Walls -- that's old technology.’ No, walls are the greatest technology. They work.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump reveals a lack of sophistication about border enforcement with these remarks. Unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) maximize efficiency and extend enforcement ranges in a way that a wall cannot. They are especially useful as an eye in the sky over far-flung or rugged parts of the border. Drones "can identify an object the size of a milk carton from an altitude of 60,000 feet," according to the Congressional Research Service. "UAVs also can provide precise and real-time imagery to a ground control operator, who would then disseminate that information so that informed decisions regarding the deployment of border patrol agents can be made quickly." Despite Trump's derisive view, the administration is incorporating a similar technology into its border plans and says it expects to deploy 200 “Autonomous Surveillance Towers” by 2022.
